Detailed Description

TimerManager.h provides managed timers to applications and control strategies

Date:
March 27, 2009
Author:
David Johan Christensen, Modular Robotics Lab, University of Southern Denmark
Note:
This software is distributed under the BSD open-source license.

Function Documentation

Timer_t* TimerManager_createOneShotTimer ( long  msDelay,
int  id,
void(handler)(int)   
)

Create a one shot timer which will call the handler after a delay of msDelay in milliseconds. The argument for the handler is the id parameter.

Timer_t* TimerManager_createPeriodicTimer ( long  msDelay,
int  id,
void(handler)(int)   
)

Create a periodic timer which will call the handler periodic with a delay of msDelay in milliseconds. The argument for the handler is the id parameter.

int TimerManager_pauseTimer ( Timer_t *  timer  ) 

Stops the timer from generating call-back events

int TimerManager_removeTimer ( Timer_t *  timer  ) 

Remove a timer.

Returns:
1 if successful

int TimerManager_resetTimer ( Timer_t *  timer  ) 

Reset a timer so that the timer will fire after msDelay milliseconds

int TimerManager_setDelay ( Timer_t *  timer,
long  msDelay 
)

Set the delay of the timer to fire after msDelay.

Returns:
1 if timer is in use

int TimerManager_startTimer ( Timer_t *  timer  ) 

Start timer if it has been paused, will automatically reset the timer
